snippet: A Westchester County grand jury voted not to indict a White Plains police officer who fatally shot a man who had mistakenly alerted an emergency system for medical help.
abstract: Westchester County grand jury votes not to indict White Plains Police Officer Anthony Carelli, who fatally shot former correction officer and Marine Kenneth Chamberlain Sr in his apartment in November 2011; jury calls the shooting of Chamberlain, who had mistakenly alerted an emergency system for medical help, tragic but finds no reasonable cause for an indictment. (M)

byline.original: By JAMES BARRON and NATE SCHWEBER; Michael Powell contributed reporting

lead_paragraph: A grand jury voted not to indict a White Plains police officer who shot and killed a 68-year-old former correction officer and former Marine in his apartment last November, the Westchester County district attorney said Thursday. District Attorney Janet DiFiore called the shooting ''a tragedy on many levels.'' But she said the grand jury had concluded that ''there was no reasonable cause'' to indict Officer Anthony Carelli, who fired the shot that killed the victim, Kenneth Chamberlain Sr.

headline.main: No Charges For Officer In the Killing Of a Man, 68
